messageBody:
Another shorter answer:

The ClassHelper methods would typically be
private/protected.

I put them on the Helper and make them public for
testability and for consolidation into utility
libraries. I postfix all the Helper classes with
Helper.

That way it communicates that this class exists to
help its target class, and only its target class.




--- Yagiz Erkan <yagizerkan@...> wrote:

> So, what's the advantage of having a all-public
> MyClassHelper when you can
> turn MyClass' methods public? I mean if you're doing
> this only for
> testability, why not to simply turn the private
> methods of a class into
> protected or package visible?
>
